comment._content: Couldn't she at least crack a smile?  What's with the deathly expression?

comment.author: 31425438@N08
comment._content: in these old photos where the subjects had to sit for long periods, they were fed lots of cakes and things to make them relax and just vegetate for the duration of the photo sitting.  she was probably stuffed and about to pass out... hence the lovely expression.

comment.author: 38362652@N05
comment._content: Looks like the girl suffered from polio or rickets by the looks of her right leg.  Shot looks like it took at least 5 seconds by the movement of the plants in an indoor environment that must have had only a few windows open for ventilation.  I'm supposing no gunpowder flash due to the exposure time and lack of highlights.  These photos are very interesting to see how we've developed technique in accordance to film speed.

comment.author: 48893148@N04
comment._content: I noticed that the fingertips of her gloves are dirty and her legs appear to be malformed and perhaps even dirty as well.  Its strange that she doesn't have stockings on.  I wonder if she was posed informally as a model by the photographer.  As far as the medical documentation speculation goes, that just doesn't make any sense.  If this were a photo used to document a medical affliction, the legs would be the main focus and feature of the photograph and not cropped just below the knee.  Also, there would be no need to photograph the child's face or her frilly dress.

comment._content: Glass plate is so awesome!

comment._content: she is probably dead.   back in that time they took portraits of the dead. thats why she probably is bare legged because she has no reputation to protect
